summary: so are you to my thoughts as food to life - FLWhite, zetaophiuchi (ryuujitsu) - SKAM (France) [Archive of Our Own]
title: so are you to my thoughts as food to life - FLWhite, zetaophiuchi (ryuujitsu) - SKAM (France) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 8/?
Fandom: SKAM (France)
Rating: Mature
Relationships: Eliott Demaury/Lucas Lallemant

Additional Tags: Cooking, Bad Cooking, Recipes, Fluff, Bipolar Disorder, Food, bone app the teeth

Summary:

Sushi I (Blossom)

prawn katsu
avocado
nori
shiso yukari
spicy tuna

The prawn roll is dusted with powdery purple flecks; with its bright orange spicy tuna topping and deep green nori wrapper, it really does look a bit like a spring blossom. Lucas collects the little black foam tray, with its single plastic leaf and dots of wasabi and pink pickled ginger, and returns to his gate.

An ongoing series of short vignettes depicting the gastronomical lives of Lucas and Eliott through the years.

Note: There is no real posting schedule. Expect sporadic updates a few times a week until we run out of steam (or until Eliott Season happens and we combust).

Thanks for reading!

summary: Elias and idriss’ situations ars different tho. Sana didn’t throw elias under the bus. It was a misunderstanding. Also sana was...
question: Elias and idriss’ situations ars different tho. Sana didn’t throw elias under the bus. It was a misunderstanding. Also sana was the one angry at elias whereas idriss is the one angry at imane.
answer: Hi! I understand what you’re saying, however, I can’t imagine either Sana or Elias not being there for the other person when they’re clearly upset & hurting. Imane shouldn’t have told on her brother, sure, but he really should have thought about why she did. He’s giving the benefit of the doubt to a girl he barely knows over his sister. His sister is crying, he knows of some of the drama in her life with the girls and Sofiane, and he just…decides to walk away without even checking on her? It makes Imane feel once again that her feelings are seen but not acknowledged. It’s a really shitty thing for Idriss to do, to be able to let his anger with her telling on him supersede his concern for her.

It makes Imane feel once again that her feelings are seen but not acknowledged. It’s a really shitty thing for Idriss to do, to be able to let his anger with her telling on him supersede his concern for her.

It makes Imane feel once again that her feelings are seen but not acknowledged. It’s a really shitty thing for Idriss to do, to be able to let his anger with her telling on him supersede his concern for her.

summary: I’d watch a season 5 about Yann, Eliott, or even Arthur before I’d watch a season of the girl squad at this point. I never...
question: I’d watch a season 5 about Yann, Eliott, or even Arthur before I’d watch a season of the girl squad at this point. I never thought I’d dislike them more than I disliked Basile for most of last season, but I really do.
answer: I’d rather have a Season 5 about the kid that just wanted Manons cakes and stole the wifi than one of the girls from the girl squad.

summary: Manon deleted the photo of her and Ingrid and they unfollowed each other 👀 is this nightmare finally ending? I can only hope.
question: Manon deleted the photo of her and Ingrid and they unfollowed each other 👀 is this nightmare finally ending? I can only hope.
answer:
That just means that something happened during their vacation. Which means that the girls are fighting with Ingrid, which means that Ingrid either said something to piss them off, or was incredibly racist, and it caused a problem for the girls.

And that will lead to the girls coming back and being like “Imane, we figured it out! Ingrid’s been a racist asshole all along! Who knew!” And I’m really not here for that. Because it shouldn’t take for the racist asshole to do something to them personally for them to realize that they’re a racist asshole and that maybe they shouldn’t have sided with them for no reason, even more so when their poc friend is telling them they’re racist.

And it’s not like Ingrid was being racist between her and Imane alone. And the girls only had to go by Imane’s word, so they weren’t sure. No. The girls were also in the same room, heard the same things, and still were like “racist?! Imane! What are you smoking?!”

But now that Ingrid did something to inconvenience them, they’ve suddenly seen the light? And are gonna go run back to Imane without actually redeeming themselves, which by the way, at this point I don’t even think they can, and Imane is supposed to…what…take them back? Because they didn’t believe her and had to wait for shit to affect them directly?

I hope they run back to Imane and have the nerve to pretend like it’s all good and that a simple “sorry” will do. I hope they do that. And when that happens, I hope Imane smiles brightly and tells them to go fuck themselves.

summary: i know the narrative hasn’t been the nicest towards the girls this season, and i agree their actions needs to be called out .......
body: i know the narrative hasn’t been the nicest towards the girls this season, and i agree their actions needs to be called out ….  that being said, i just think it’s funny how fast this fandom is to hate woman and be really nasty and derogatory towards the girls when at the same time you’re all so fast to praise the boys squad for doing absolutely nothing, and always saying how you want an eliott season and an arthur season (rather than alexia or daphné) like the misogyny and internalised misogyny really shows i have to say

summary: Can you even imagine Elias - Mr If You’re Sad Then I’m Sad - seeing Sana upset & just walking away without a care? He’d go buy...
body: Can you even imagine Elias - Mr If You’re Sad Then I’m Sad - seeing Sana upset & just walking away without a care? He’d go buy ice cream, put on her fave movie and cancel plans with the boy squad to spend time with her (only they’d still turn up cos they have no idea about space & they want ice cream)

summary: One thing which I hope one of the remakes shows is either the Yousef or Elias character seeing someone make an ignorant comment...
body: One thing which I hope one of the remakes shows is either the Yousef or Elias character seeing someone make an ignorant comment to the Sana character & everyone gets surprised when they get mad cos they’re so usually chill. It would be interesting to see how they would react given they’ve grown up with her & are protective of her. For the Sana character to be like ‘yo, it’s okay’ whilst they go ‘no it isn’t!!”

summary: If season 5 will be about Daphné I’m gonna laugh so hard. You have to make a character likeable in previous seasons and...
question: If season 5 will be about Daphné I’m gonna laugh so hard. You have to make a character likeable in previous seasons and encourage audience to watch in the next season. Honestly, i don’t know if anyone tolerates her and I’m not gonna watch season about racist twat
answer:
I’m not really interested in a Daphne season anymore, no matter what it tackles. Same goes for the rest of the girls.

They’ve been a little too horrible for an entire season and knowing that they won’t even have to put much effort into being redeemed makes me not want to bother with any of their possible upcoming seasons because they have certainly not earned it and won’t earn it in one episode either.
